title: Soldiers serving at Eryx honour their commander
support: A large rectangular limestone block, damaged around the edges of the face and with some material lost from both the top and bottom. The surface is badly weathered. The remains of a clamp-hole (vel sim) preserved front left of the top surface. The rear is very uneven with a large rounded protrusion.

layout.p: Greek text is visible over 10 lines, although much of the initial lines in particular is now lost

handNote.lettering: Where visible, the letters are plainly and regularly cut, without serifs. Epsilon has short middle bar, omicron is full size, omega is closed and slightly elliptical

date._: Late Hellenistic (period of the Roman Republican province)

provenanceFound._: First recorded on the site by Antonio Agustín in 1559-1560
